page.title: 04St John Baptist, Claines
page.content: Church of England. A wooden Saxon church existed in 957 AD but was replaced by a stone Norman church at the direction of St. Wulstan, Bishop of Worcester. Original building altered and enlarged - now consists of choir, vestry, lady chapel, St. Catherine's chapel and seating for circa 400 people. Three services are held each Sunday and a Communion each Wednesday morning. Weddings, christenings, funerals and festivals are also held. Average attendance at morning service is 200. The Choir consists of 20 boys and 15 men. There is a Vicar and full-time curate. Organizations linked to the church - Guides, Brownies, Scouts, Cubs, Girls Friendly Society, Anorak Club, Mothers Union, Wives Fellowship. Family service held each month at which these are represented.
